comments.author: faaborg@gmail.com
comments.text:
This somehow fell off my radar.  We have a new command "Getting Started" in the Firefox menu, and it was meant to be displayed in the traditional menu bar as well.  I believe it might still exist in the bookmarks toolbar default set, but that isn't displayed by default.

Not a big deal for 4, but something we should get around to fixing.

comments.author: steffen.wilberg@web.de
comments.text:
Just need to copy "appmenu_gettingStarted" from browser-appmenu.inc to baseMenuOverlay.xul.

This doesn't provide an accesskey though, and we're past "the last string has landed".

Same issue as bug 611568 comment 35:
Can we live without the accesskey? The entire History and Bookmarks menus lack accesskeys, and I can't even find a bug about that. You can still navigate the menus using the arrow keys.
